oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Residues re-open argument on organic standards
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Huber, Beate
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The residue contents in organic food is significantly distinguishable from conventionally produced food. While in conventional products residues can often be detected organic food is to a high percentage (95%) free of residues.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Huber, Beate (2003) Residues re-open argument on organic standards. The Organic Standard (24), pp. 13-14.
